title: 115_hr1574
content: The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" is a bill that aims to provide viewpoint protection in communications. It amends Title I of the Communications Act of 1934 to include a section on viewpoint protection. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the revocation of licenses or other actions based on viewpoints expressed on public issues in broadcast content. It also prohibits placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits revocation of licenses or actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content. It also prohibits placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. This section clarifies that the Commission retains authority to take action based on violations of specific laws. The bill prohibits actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content and clarifies the Commission's authority to take action on violations of specific laws related to radio or television broadcast. The bill prohibits actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content and clarifies the Commission's authority to take action on violations of specific laws related to radio or television broadcast. The President may not direct an agency to take action against any person based on viewpoints expressed on issues of public importance in content. The bill prohibits actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content and clarifies the Commission's authority to take action on violations of specific laws related to radio or television broadcast. The President may not direct an agency to place conditions on approvals or decisions with respect to viewpoints on public issues in content broadcast by the person seeking approval. The bill prohibits actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content and clarifies the Commission's authority to take action on violations of specific laws related to radio or television broadcast. The President's authority to direct an agency to take action on violations of certain laws is not affected by this subsection. The bill prohibits actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content and clarifies the Commission's authority to take action on violations of specific laws related to radio or television broadcast, including sections 1343 and 1464 of the title. The bill prohibits actions based on viewpoints in broadcast content and clarifies the Commission's authority to take action on violations of specific laws related to radio or television broadcast. The term "agency" is defined in this subsection as given in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
